Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: OCHillie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel November 9, 10 and 11 before departing for Florence. Was surprised at how close the hotel was to everything...down the street, cross the road and walk through a small side street and turn the corner to see Trevi Fountains all lit up the first night we got there...then a quick walk to the pathenon and then pizza navorna......also up the street and around the corner is the metro......the staff were extremely friendly allowing me to use their internet anytime, breakfast was great, lots of selection. We eventually returned to the hotel for two more nights at the end of our Italian vacation. Both times, we were housed in the annex, which is next door. First time 3rd floor which gave us a great workout as we did not use the elevator. Second visit on the 1st floor. Both rooms were spacious with a good size bathroom. The rooms are typical older Italian style but when in Rome (or italy)......this was a fabulous trip with sunny days every day, even for November....I would highly recommend this hotel if you are not expecting 5 star amenities. We will be back.....

Reviews.Title: “So convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Fearn730
Reviews.Content: While this place is unpretentious, it's a great deal for the price. Our room was quiet, clean and comfortable with excellent AC which we needed the last week of August. It's very close to the Trevi fountain & subway to everything else. The staff was so kind & helpful. Breakfast was nothing amazing, but there was lots of it! We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: TOl3
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay at Domus Julia Hotel recently with my husband and children. The hotel was recommended to me by family, and I have since recommended it to others. The hotel was in a great location - on a quiet street, just a 5 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain. We stayed in the family suite, which was very clean and large enough to accommodate us comfortably. The breakfasts were delicious and the staff members were courteous and helpful. The one and only fault I can make is in relation to the hairdryer; I thought it was a bit old and lacked power. But this was a minor issue. Domus Julia is not a luxury hotel, but it's clean and comfortable and represents great value for money. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little b&b in the heart of Rome's historic centre”
Reviews.Author: Vicstick77
Reviews.Content: Having read some previous negative reviews about the hotel on this site (after i'd already booked to stay there), I was expecting very basic accomodation, so it was a wonderful surprise to find that the negative reviews were inaccurate (in my humble opinion). The Domus Julia is clean, tidy and very comfortable. The room was functional and attractive enough & air conditioned. The bed was was comfy and our room was quiet. Plenty of piping hot water for showering etc. We found the staff to be very friendly and good humoured-they are available at the front desk 24/7, should you need them and spoke good English. They are able to book day trips for you and provided a very helpful map of the city and leaflets about travel options. Breakfast was good, offering a range of pastries, cereal, meats, cheeses and beverages. The location was absolutely suberb! The Barberini Gallery is at the top of the street and Piazza Barberini is a two minute walk away (a metro station is located there which links to Vatican, Colosseum, Termini station, etc and is very easy & safe to use). It is a 10 minute walk to both the Trevi Fountain and The Spanish Steps, and there are plenty of bars and restaurants at hand (which is not the case in every area). I highly recommend the Domus Julia. Our stay there was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here unless you have no money to spend elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaCAtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights. What a mistake...They first put up in a terrible hotel room then moved us the next day to a supposed to be better place next door for the next 4 nights. Another nightmare. The room was a little better it had 2 twin beds which were clean but very uncomfortable. We had NO hot water for the 4 nights we spent here. The location is great and the staff was friendly. The breakfast was not great...If you can afford to stay elsewhere you should...It is definately not a 3 star hotel. More like 1 and 1/2 or 2 at best.

Reviews.Title: “We would return”
Reviews.Author: J049
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Friendly and helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LilianaP
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 2 children ages 10 & 13 for 4 days in July. The room was spacious, clean and the location was quiet. Our family enjoyed the proximity to the Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. Barberini subway stop was a short 3 minute walk. The staff was helpful and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Breakfast was included. Delicious pastries, yogurt etc. though the cheese and ham could have been varied with other choices. Would certainly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Domus Julia was Great!”
Reviews.Author: VATravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful Italian vacation. We spent two nights at Domus Julia in Rome. The room was spacious, clean, in a great central location, and the staff were very helpful. Our room had a queen size bed and cost 165 Euro/night. I would highly recommend Domus Julia!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place very close to everything”
Reviews.Author: culchieValencia
Reviews.Content: Stayed nine people for the New Year's Eve at the Domus Julia apartments. Everything was fantastic: the place, the furniture, the location, maintenance, staff, etc. Rosa did her utmost to keep us happy and we did appreciate all the flexibility and good advices that all the personnel offered to us. The appartment is right next door the hotel in a quiet street very close to Trevi fountain, just five minutes walking to the Spanish Steps and no more than 15 minutes walking to Piazza Venezia. There is also a supermarket down the street that opens everyday till 10:00 pm so you can always buy something and cook at the appartment. I highly recommend to anyone visiting Rome to stay here and if you are travelling in a group no wonder that this is the best option you can find. Enjoy your stay as much as we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Domus Julia a good choice and a good location”
Reviews.Author: Mebrothers
Reviews.Content: Domus Julia is a great value and nice little hotel. It’s the apartment annex to the Hotel Julia, so you check in and have breakfast buffet at the hotel, which includes warm boiled eggs, sliced ham, croissants, cereals, yoghurt, capuccino. It is a fine little place, in a great location, at a very reasonable price. We had a double/twin room, which was large enough by European standards (and is pictured on their website quite accurately). It was 170EUR, with a private bath, and including the breakfast buffet. We entered our room via a nice dining room/kitchen common area. There were two other units which shared that space, and I think they are larger apartments and might suit our family of four. They offer a 13EUR shuttle from the airport, which is a big cost-savings.

Reviews.Title: “Dank and Dreary”
Reviews.Author: 2Weary
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by a travel agent. The location is a 15 minute walk to anything. Hotel staff was any thing but helpful. We had no hot water for the first day. The breakfast consisted of old pastries and juice that was foaming. To enter your rooms, you exit the hotel onto the street and use one of three keys you are given into a long, dark hallway. You then have to unlock another door to get to a suite of rooms and then use another key for your room. Room was noisy, traffic and other guests. Very dark, musty. Beds had the springs coming through. Very unpleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Julia for 4 nights. The positives: the room was very clean, the personnel were mostly helpful, the location is excellent, the breakfast good. Negatives: the air conditioning remote control(necc. for its operation) had been removed and was never found (it wasn't "hot" to the Italians, so they apparently didn't think we should need the a/c); the hair dryer hose was broken (although they fixed it finally); the phone didn't work (it was fixed after the 2nd complaint, but not before we had waited 2 hours for a phone call that never came). The amount/quality of service depended totally on who was at the desk. At $200/night everything should have worked. Next time I will look for a hotel in the Trastevere district, which is in a charming and cheaper district, withing easy walking distance of all the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In October 2005 we stayed in Room 11 at Domus Julia , which is adjacent to Hotel Julia, where the front desk, little bar, and breakfast room are located. The room was spacious, clean, well furnished, air conditioned and comfortable. The street below was noisy but with the window closed at night it was not a problem. The bathroom was also spacious. Our only complaint was that the shower head in the tub/shower was located on the back wall not an end wall (uncomfortable and hard to use) and there was some unpleasant mildew around the tub. There was an elevator, although it was an easy climb up the stairs, and we are in our early 70's. The room looked exactly like the photo in the brochure. There was also a safe located in the armoire, and a little frig. The location on Via Rasella was perfect in every way for our 4 nite stay ( 150 Euros per nite) which included a lovely, abundant breakfast with cereal, pastries, soft boiled eggs, rolls, cold cuts, cheese, fruit, juice, coffee and tea. We walked everywhere, Trevi Fountain just a few blocks away, Spanish Steps too. Even shorter to the Metro stop, Hop On/Hop Off Tour Bus stop, wonderful restaurants far too numerous to mention in every direction, all within walking distance. Via Veneto, Piazza Barberini all close by as well. Taxis were never more than 10 Euros one way for the sights located a bit out of our walking reach, like the Vatican, Piazza Navonna, Campo di Fiore and the Pantheon etc. We found that ordering the set/fixed menu for the day was the least expensive way to go, and the food was always delicious, especially the pastas without exception. We were usually confused about whether the bread and service charge was included or not...... Gelato shops seemed to be on every corner, a temptation we found difficult to resist..... Rosa and the staff at the Hotel are extremely helpful, she answered my every little question before arrival, and during our stay as well. She arranged for transfer from our cruise ship and to the airport with a very good driver with a station wagon to accomodate our huge luggage. The hotel also offers free internet use, which made staying in touch with our family so easy and reassuring. We are recommending this quaint hotel and its fabulous location to all our friends and would definitely stay there again. Thank you Rosa and staff !

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: lattemom1
Reviews.Content: We had a nice spacious room and huge bathroom. WE had plenty of room for four people. The Domus Julia is in an excellent location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very basic. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Rome on our honeymoon and stayed in Rome for 5 days. We picked Domus Julia because is was central to everything. Rosa and her staff were awesome and the accomadations were fantasic. The apartment (double) was spacious and more that up to date. Getting around was easy and close to everything (we used the Metro to only go to the Vatican). Rosa's staff were great with maps and were stuff was and with suggestions for dinner. Another review said that they had to walk down a long walkway in the dark which is inaccurate. The light is on the right hand side and is lite up. It is a little noisy on the street but just shut the window and it blocks out all the noise. There is no doubt I would stay there again when I travel back Thanks Rosa and staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Domus hotel - terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Julia Hotel in Rome. The Domus Julia is part of the Domus Hotel, it's an appartment next door to the hotel. At this hotel we paid 160 euros/night, it is not as nice as was suggested. The hallway leads to the room is dark, I almost tripped twice because of the long hall way. You have to walk 2m in the dark before you can get to the light switch. However, the room is spacious, OK. The staffs there are just ok, not as friendly as other hotel we stayed in and their English is not so great either. Personally, I would not come back there again even if it was a bargain. April 05

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. It's a 2 minute walk to the Barbarini Metro stop, less than 5 to the Trevi Fountain. Lots of restaurants nearby. The room was very spacious and a good bargain. Very private. However, there is definitely some street noise, so closing the windows at night might be helpful. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: louropa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our last night in Italy on a recent trip. Our previous experience in Rome had been hampered by the terrible Hotel King, so we were a little scared going here (if that was a 3 star, what would this look like?). It was great! The room was huge. It was clean (except the bathtub - could've used a little more work), the furniture - although not fancy - was new and kept well. The people were very nice and helpful. They easily arranged for a van to take us to the airport. Breakfast could've been better (even their espresso and cappucino was bad), but all in all it was a very good experience. I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June for 2 nights and loved it. It is actually a converted apartment so there is a shared entry lobby area and three rooms off of it. Our room was very spacious and quite cozy. It felt like an apartment in itself. The hotel next door, Hotel Julia, is related to this one so all the amenities of it are offered to the Domus's guests and the staff were very helpful. They actually have someone come serve you breakfast in your "room" (the lobby is more like a kitchen), although we were unable to try it due to our early start on the day. I think this would be the perfect place for a couple families to come and stay together, renting out the whole apartment. We stayed in our rooms and never saw another guest but it would be great to leave the doors open and have one open apartment and simply retire to the individual rooms at night. Overall we really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Domus Julia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Domus Julia was all that it advertised, quaint, clean, centrally located and with a fabulous ambience. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Julia December 17th-21st, 2003. The price came to about $145/night because the dollar was way down at the time. We had a deluxe room on the front of the building with a view over the street. This was very large, clean, had a wonderful bed and bathroom. Rosa (the owner or manager) was wonderful and so friendly in welcoming us to the Domus. My brother stayed here for 3 nights and his room was much smaller, but had a balcony on the back. We were served breakfast in bed and felt like we had our own apartment in Rome. It is a 5 minute walk to the Trevi fountain and in a lovely quiet neighborhood. We had a great meal around the corner at the highly recommended Colline Emiliane... Domus Julia is a gem and we would absolutely stay again!

HotelInfo.Name: Domus Julia
HotelInfo.Address: Via Rasella 32, 00187 Rome, Italy
